data.title: Local Weekend Mass Times
data.text:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Mass list includes all Catholic churches in McLean, Livingston, Logan, DeWitt, Woodford, Ford, Dekalb, Grundy County, and even northwestern portion of Champaign County & southern LaSalle and parts of Kendal & Will County. We will soon add the Harvard Illinois and eventually the Rockford area to our lists. All churches are part of Diocese of Peoria unless otherwise noted. Spanish Mass is in red font. If you hover over Mass on the main menu, click drop down menu options for daily Mass, Confession & Adoration list. We include streaming info for parishes who stream Mass in addition to people attending in-person.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

​

WEEKEND LOCAL CHURCH'S MASS TIMES

​

ATLANTA (Logan County)

​

ST. MARY: 808 Pearl Street

Sunday: 8:30AM

​

BELVIDERE (Boone County)

​

ST. JAMES: 402 Church St.

BENSON (Woodford County)

​

ST. JOHN: 209 Jefferson Street

Sunday: 8AM

BLOOMINGTON-NORMAL

​

EPIPHANY in Normal: 1000 E. College Avenue

MASSES: Saturday: 4PM Sunday: 7:30AM, 9AM and 11AM 5;30PM (NEW TIMES)

7:30AM Mass will also be streamed online. www.youtube.com/@epiphanycatholicchurchscho472/streams

​

HOLY TRINITY in Bloomington: 711 N. Main Street

Saturday: 4PM Sunday: 10AM Sunday's Mass is live-streamed. Saturday's is not.

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCaiW9jK6oVDdeXKRxHYOaJA

NOTE: DEACON AL, WHO IS A PARISHIONER OF HOLY TRINITY CHURCH HOSTS A PROGRAM FOR TEENS AND ANYONE WHO MIGHT BENEFIT. TUNE IN SATURDAY & SUNDAY AT 8PM TO THE PROGRAM: GOOD NEWS

​

OSF ST. JOSEPH MEDICAL CENTER CHAPEL in Bloomington: 2200 E. Washington Street

Sunday: 11AM

Masses are currently open to OSF Mission Partners, currrent patients and patient support persons ONLY. They look forward to the day when we can once again open our chapel to the public.

​

ST. JOHN PAUL II NEWMAN CENTER in Normal: 501 S. Main Street

(It formerly was known as St. Robert Bellarmine. Mass, Confession and Adoration are open to the public. Other activities are exclusively for Illinois State, Illinois Wesleyan and Heartland College students.)

*During summer: Sunday: 5PM

​

ST. MARY in Bloomington: 527 W. Jackson Street

Saturday: 4PM. Sunday: 8:30AM 10:15AM 12:15PM-SPANISH. All Masses are streamed. A new youtube channel in spring 2024l: Livestream: https://www.youtube.com/@St.MarysCatholicChurch-yx3qh/streams

ST. PATRICK CHURCH OF MERNA (in Bloomington): 1001N. Towanda Barnes Road

Saturday: 4PM Sunday: 7:30AM 9AM 11AM

Mass can be watched online. 4PM AND 9 AM are live streamed.

Two options for streaming Mass: https://www.facebook.com/stpatrickmerna/

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5LD661cnTl63vJ7QodxXOw

​​

When attending Mass, the Diocese of Peoria wants you to keep this in mind,

* WARNING OF POTENTIAL RISK ASSUMED BY PARISHIONERS OF DIOCESE OF PEORIA PARISHES:

“While our parish staffs will attempt to take appropriate precautions consistent with the advice of public health authorities, parishioners and guests should understand that they assume the risk of contracting COVID-19 anytime they enter a public space since such precautions do not eliminate the risk of infection.”
